alert.note: Alert for McKean (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued November 27 at 6:52PM EST until November 29 at 1:00AM EST by NWS State College
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 AM EST WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Lake effect snow. Total snow accumulations of 2 to 7 inches. The higher amounts will be north of Route 6 and west of Bradford. * WHERE...McKean County. * WHEN...Until 1 AM EST Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning and evening commutes, especially on Tuesday. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...The heaviest snow and most significant impacts will occur after midnight tonight, through Tuesday as the single, intense snow band over Eastern Lake Erie this evening drifts gradually south into the advisory area and breaks into several bands. Snowfall rates may reach 1" per hour for brief times within the strongest snow bands. Gusty winds will also lead to blowing and drifting snow with periods of very low visibility of less than one quarter of a mile.
info.instruction: The Pennsylvania Department of Transportation and Pennsylvania Turnpike Commission remind motorists to adjust speeds based on driving conditions as winter weather impacts will include snow covered roads and limited visibility in some areas. Call 5 1 1 or visit www.511pa.com for the latest travel, roadway and traffic conditions. To report snow or ice, post to the NWS State College Facebook page, use Twitter @NWSStateCollege, or visit weather.gov/ctp.
